content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun concept

(hi) Hi to all, dear reviewers : thanks for watching my contribution :-) !

As @21stCenturyPeon alerts me, i'd like to collect your opinion too :
-> Will this clash too difficult to solve, for you too, *in reverse mode*, in the 5 suggested minutes ?

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very cool idea for a Clash! Well explained and tests well for edge cases.

1) The name of the test case should not be the answer to the test.

2) It's a good Fastest or Shortest, but I don't think it's suitable for a Reverse.

3) "the first more spicier flavor" is unclear. It sounds like:
- the first on the list that Tom hasn't tried AND is spicier than everything Tom has tried
when the Hungarian Wax test shows that it means:
- the least spicy flavor that Tom hasn't tried AND is spicier than everything Tom has tried

Suggested text: "The least-spicy flavor that is spicier than everything Tom has tried"

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment:
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
Amazing Idea for a clash, I suggest to take more about the criteria

La phrase : "la premi√®re davantage piment√©e" n'est pas claire du tout.

Je dirais plut√¥t : "Parmi les sauces que Tom n'a pas encore go√ªt√©es, trouvez la sauce la moins √©pic√©e tout en √©tant plus √©pic√©e que toutes celles d√©j√† go√ªt√©es jusqu'√† pr√©sent."
Many duplicates in last test and last validator. Is it normal ?

Super effective clash code as we like them.
Is it voluntary to present only 2 variables when we have 4?
The 4 variables I see (apart from the list of peppers on the market) are:

n => the count of peppers and sauces Tom already tasted

known spiciness => the unit of measurement of the pepper's power in SHU which corresponds to an integer and has the power that Tom knows/supports

p => the number of lines representing the peppers available on the market with the name/spiceness couple

spiciness available=> same as for Tom's except that these are the ones available on the market

In fact, I wonder about the modes offered by this clash: speed, code size and reverse.
Regarding the speed, giving the spiceness variables as input without processing the character strings, in my opinion, accelerates the speed of resolution and would make it even more fun for the code size mode.

Take this just like a suggestion, I find it fun and nice to do, very good job !
Contribution really adapted for a clash of code, good job !
üëç

Goal section
* Please explain the selection criteria.

Input section
* Actually the strings are more than comma separated. They are separated by a comma and a space (both of which have to be taken into account when writing the code).

Output section
* You may format "None" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Thanks.

Hi @5DN1L, thanks for your useful suggestions :-) !

* I've added the explanation in this Goal line :
"Indicate (...) the first more spicier flavor he should taste soon"

* I've updated all my test cases with comma separation only

* I've surrended the "None" constant with the recommended format.

=> What do you think about these changes ?

Hi @GamerPsy and thanks for your feedback !
(you can also write me in french ;-))

well, there is effectively 2 variables and 2 "2d" arrays (or lists) in this clash,
but the sauce (or pepper) name is necessary for the answer ;-) ...

yes, you're true, processing strings takes a small bit of time, but there's today embedded functions in any languages here to do this, including the hardest one, in C !

about code size, as you can see : you can easily "compress" my solution,
but yes, i think it would be an additional (funny ?) exercise ...

and for reverse mode, i've checked to suggest logically what to do since the firsts test cases ...
-> and special cases come after -> i think there will be no problem ?

Hi @Zezeze and thanks for your question !
(you can also write me in french ;-))

You're right, in the latest test and validator, i've pushed all my researches on SHU,
-> so the lists are bigger than others test cases, with many similarities together,
but it's the final one ... if you're all right for others, you may not need to compute them manually ;-) !

re- Bonjour et Merci @Zezeze pour ce retour :-) !
-> j'ai essay√© de reformuler et d'int√©grer ta suggestion √† l'√©nonc√© ...

=> n'h√©sites pas √† me dire si √ßa passe maintenant mieux qu'avant ?

Hi @ialali and thanks for your comment : what type of criteria do you think about ?
-> can u develop your minds, please ?

Hi @21stCenturyPeon and thanks for your message !

well, i didn't read in the tuto that was not allowed to name a test case as the awaited answer, but i was not inspired enough to name them else ...
-> what kind of title do you feel appropriate to use for them, please ?

Yes, you're true, in Reverse mode the player can't read the statements, but when you read carefully enough ... i think the answer is not hidden, it's a bit of logical analysis and a part of dare or adventure ;-) !
-> on your opinion : what may i do/add/change to be easier in Reverse too ?

OK for your 3rd suggestion, i've updated my statements :+1:.
9 days left to reply ;-) ...

Actually, I was suggesting that you just untick Reverse from the Game Modes. Yes, it's doable as a Reverse, but not in the 5 minutes the guidelines suggest.

As for the titles, my instinct was that it would encourage cheating, but I realise now that (a), that won't help on the validators, and (b) they can already see the correct output as soon as they submit a wrong answer. Feel free to ignore that one :)

OK thanks @21stCenturyPeon for your quick reply ;-) !

You're the first "worry tester" for Reverse i read in this contribution ...
-> but, maybe you're right !
=> I'll ask the question in the Top messages to get others reviewers opinion too ;-).
Je veux dire qu'il y a des √©l√©ments dupliqu√©s au sein m√™me de chaque liste...

Oui, Merci @Zezeze de l'avoir remarqu√© ; c'est normal et volontaire de ma part ...
-> √ßa permettra effectivement de tester si les cas de duplications sont bien correctement g√©r√©s par nos amis de la communaut√© ;-) !
Hi Jp82! It looks better now! Thanks.
